description: Special trains will run from Nagpur to Mumbai on December 14 and 15 to help legislators return after the winter session, addressing IndiGo flight cancellations. The Maharashtra Legislative Council chairperson confirmed the arrangements, emphasizing the state government's request to the Railways. Matters concerning Vidarbha will be prioritized during the session.

description: An official said that Metro Rail has mobilised a large number of workers to complete the construction before the end of December

title: Rera to builders in Karnataka: Insure common areas or pay for disaster repairs
description: Karnataka Rera has raised the bar for construction standards by enforcing a policy that compels builders to secure insurance for communal areas, underlining their accountability for potential disaster recovery costs. Following a recent clubhouse fire, developers are now required to provide verifiable insurance documentation within a tight 30-day window.

title: Trump ‘a little disappointed’ Zelenskyy hasn’t read US peace plan as Miami talks stall
description: US President Trump expressed disappointment that Ukrainian President Zelenskyy has not yet reviewed a peace proposal, while Russia has accepted it. Talks in Miami concluded with lingering territorial and security guarantee issues. Zelenskyy acknowledged the need for detailed discussions on proposals to end the conflict and prevent further Russian aggression.

title: ‘Nobody knows when will bodies arrive…’: Grief hangs heavy at Delhi home as 4 of family killed in Goa club fire
'Recipe for disaster': Why Delhi nightclubs are on knife’s edge
description: A devastating fire at a nightclub in Goa, claiming the lives of 25 people, has thrown a glaring spotlight on the inadequate fire safety measures in Delhi's entertainment spots. In spite of existing regulations, many venues suffer from overcrowded layouts, obstructed exits, and flammable decor, while maintenance seems to be a low priority.

title: Palash Muchhal deletes proposal video, while Smriti Mandhana removes all photos with him
description: Music composer Palash Muchhal and cricketer Smriti Mandhana have officially called off their wedding, originally scheduled for November 24, 2025.  Following health scares for Smriti's father and Palash's hospitalization, the couple confirmed the decision in separate statements.  Muchhal has since deleted proposal videos and other shared memories from his social media.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection: Ranveer Singh starrer scores Rs 100 crore India opening
description: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has achieved a phenomenal opening week at the box office, exceeding trade expectations. The film delivered an explosive debut weekend, grossing Rs 119 crore domestically and over Rs 140 crore worldwide. This marks Ranveer Singh's career-best launch and a significant milestone for debutante Sara Arjun.

title: ‘Wanted a son’: Less than hour after giving birth, woman kills baby in Ghaziabad, arrested

description: Former batting coach Sanjay Bangar strongly defended Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's place in the ODI team, citing their exceptional records. He argued that established stars, having retired from other formats, deserve time to regain match fitness and their presence significantly boosts team morale and confidence, especially after tough losses.

title: 'It's time ...': Wedding cancelled! What Mandhana and Palash said in their statements
description: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has confirmed the cancellation of her wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal, ending weeks of social media speculation. Both individuals have requested privacy for their families and expressed their desire to move forward. Muchhal also stated his team will take legal action against those spreading defamatory content.

description: In the video, Mr. Mamdani vowed to protect the city's 3 million immigrants, saying, “We can all stand up to ICE if you know your rights.”

Dessert storm: Mithai marauders strike sweet shop 10 times in 9 years
description: A Nadiad confectionery has been repeatedly targeted by burglars, experiencing 10 break-ins in nine years. Thieves have stolen significant quantities of sweets, often in addition to cash. Despite owner Mukesh Pandit's efforts, including installing CCTVs, the burglaries continue, particularly during VVIP visits and festivals when police presence is reduced.

title: ‘Delhi-Srinagar for Rs 54K, could fly to UK instead: Flyers still hassled at IGIA amid IndiGo crisis

description: Borussia Dortmund has cemented third place in the Bundesliga with a 2-0 win over Hoffenheim

title: CJI Surya Kant bats for tech-enabled jail reforms, UK-style monitoring
description: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant champions tech-driven prison reforms, advocating for digital skills training and UK-style inmate monitoring to transform correctional facilities into reintegration hubs. He stressed industry partnerships for apprenticeships and recruitment, aiming to equip inmates with future-ready skills and reduce recidivism through measurable rehabilitation.

title: Assam govt to hand over 992 acres to AAI for Silchar greenfield airport
description: The cabinet approved the transfer of 3,000 bighas at Doloo Tea Estate in Silchar to the AAI for the construction of a greenfield airport, says Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: World becoming more multi-polar makes compelling case for deeper multilateralism: Jaishankar
description: The 20th session of the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage will take place at the Red Fort from December 8 to 13.

title: Goa nightclub fire: NCR family vacay ends in grief; woman loses husband, 3 sisters
description: A family's Goan holiday turned tragic when a fire engulfed a nightclub, claiming four lives. Bhavana Joshi miraculously survived after her husband pushed her to safety before re-entering the inferno to save his sisters-in-law. The devastating incident left her the sole survivor, facing the grim task of informing their children of their parents' and aunts' untimely deaths.

title: DTC driver beaten to death after jam due to wedding triggers spat
description: A DTC bus driver was beaten to death by wedding guests in Delhi after a road rage incident. The driver, Vikas, was allegedly assaulted when his bus got stuck behind a marriage procession. One suspect has been arrested, while three others remain at large.

title: A hundred years ago | Rains in the south
Did IndiGo 'waste time'? Govt probe to cover why airline delayed preps for new norms
description: A government panel is investigating IndiGo's alleged delay in preparing for new flight duty rules, potentially lobbying for exemptions instead. The probe will examine if this inaction, alongside other operational lapses, caused the recent flight crisis. The airline's failure to report preparedness and the DGCA's handling of the situation are also under scrutiny.

title: Horoscope Today, December 8, 2025: Astrological Insights for Scorpio, Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, and Every Sun Sign
100 kidnapped Nigerian schoolchildren released: Report
description: The 100 children are set to be handed over to local government officials in Niger state on Monday (December 9), according to the United Nations source

title: Fifty years ago | Indonesia lands troops in Dili: Guerillas flee
Goa inferno: 'Island' club with narrow path leading to it made firefighting a challenge
description: A devastating fire at Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub in Arpora, Goa, claimed 25 lives, exposing severe infrastructure flaws. Built on a salt pan with limited access and inadequate safety measures, the venue's design, including a poorly ventilated basement and a single operational exit on the first floor, hampered rescue efforts. Investigations are underway into the club's safety protocols.

title: Air ambulance for Bangladesh's ex-PM Khaleda Zia to land in Dhaka on Tuesday
description: A senior official at the Civil Aviation Authority of Bangladesh (CAAB) said the aircraft has been allotted an 8 a.m. landing slot on Tuesday, with a departure time of 9 p.m. the same day, news portal bdnews24.com reported.

title: Goa tragedy: No fire clearance for club, violated building norms too
description: A devastating fire at The Birch by Romeo Lane was attributed to critical failures in fire prevention, regulatory compliance, and life safety preparedness by club owners. The establishment lacked a construction license and a fire department NOC, with zero fire safety measures in place. Obstructed exits and hazardous external firework activities exacerbated the tragedy, trapping victims.

title: IIT-Bombay steps into future with its own AI firm
description: IIT Bombay has incorporated BharatGen Technology Foundation, a company dedicated to building a Large Language Model reflecting India's diversity. This national sovereign AI effort, backed by significant government funding, aims to develop AI that understands over 22 Indian languages and provides accessible models for developers and enterprises.

title: Russian strikes kill 4 in Ukraine as Kremlin praises new U.S. security strategy
description: The document released by the White House said the U.S. wants to improve its relationship with Russia after years of Moscow being treated as a global pariah and that ending the war is a core U.S. interest to "reestablish strategic stability with Russia".

title: Manish Tewari brings bill in Lok Sabha seeking to let MPs take their own voting line
description: Congress MP Manish Tewari has introduced a private member's bill in Lok Sabha to amend the anti-defection law. The proposed changes aim to allow MPs to vote independently on most bills and motions, except those affecting government stability. This move seeks to free parliamentarians from party whips and promote better lawmaking.

title: Benin President says situation 'under control' after coup bid
description: I would like to assure you that the situation is completely under control and therefore invite you to calmly go about your activities starting this very evening, says Benin's President Patrice Talon

title: India, US line up high-level visits to advance cooperation
description: US under secretary Allison Hooker is in India from December 7-11 to bolster the strategic partnership. Her visit, encompassing New Delhi and Bengaluru, aims to deepen economic ties, boost American exports, and foster collaboration in emerging technologies like AI and space exploration. Discussions will cover bilateral cooperation and regional security, underscoring a commitment to a free and open Indo-Pacific.

title: Panic grips Assam migrant workers facing eviction in U.P.
description: On December 4, a team from the Lucknow Municipal Corporation led by mayor Sushma Kharkwal arrived to check documents, aiming to identify ‘Bangladeshis and Rohingya’ people living in the area illegally

Stone-pelting on Bajrang Dal's procession in Haridwar; heavy police force deployed
description: The Bajrang Dal had organised a 'Shaurya Yatra' in the evening. The procession started from three different locations in Haridwar and the stone-pelting incident took place as soon as it reached Ram Chowk in Jwalapur, the officials said.

title: Ladakh to Arunachal, Rajnath Singh inaugurates 125 border projects
description: Defence minister Rajnath Singh inaugurated 125 border infrastructure projects, including the Shyok tunnel in Ladakh, at a cost of Rs 5,000 crore. These projects will enhance troop mobility, boost tourism and employment, and strengthen faith in democracy in remote regions. Singh highlighted their importance for security, economy, and disaster management, emphasizing connectivity as a backbone of national security.

description: It was good, good banter. He's a good competitor, and he comes hard at you, so it was good fun, says  Australia captain Steve Smith

title: Goa fire: Night out becomes nightmare for Bengaluru youth; 20-yr-old woman suffers burns
description: A group of young tourists from Bengaluru experienced a holiday turned nightmare in Goa when a fire broke out during a club performance. A 20-year-old woman sustained severe burns and is undergoing treatment, while friends recounted the chaotic evacuation. A doctor couple from Mumbai also caught in the incident, with the husband receiving treatment for burns.

title: Voters who participated in Campco society election in a spot
description: With the ink mark still visible, voters fear polling officials may mistake it for the ink used in the local body elections, potentially causing confusion

description: The plan's initial steps saw Israeli troops withdraw to positions behind a so-called "Yellow Line" in Gaza, though still in control of more than half the territory

title: Goa nightclub tragedy: Fire started by electric crackers; bodies found on top of each other
description: A devastating fire at Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub in Arpora claimed 25 lives, including five tourists, late Saturday night. The blaze, believed to have started from electric firecrackers igniting the wooden ceiling, trapped many in the basement, leading to suffocation. Authorities have registered a culpable homicide case against the club owners and arrested four staff members.

title: IndiGo crisis: On government push, airline refunds Rs 610 crore, delivers 3,000 bags
description: Airline silent on pending number of refunds and pieces of baggage

title: With Bolsonaro in jail, Brazil’s right in disarray as Trump warms up to Lula
description: The former President’s absence has done little to rally his supporters even as his family is embroiled in a bitter succession battle; the markets and U.S. officials signal waning support for the Bolsonaro brand; with legal troubles and low public backing, the far-right in Brazil faces a turbulent path ahead

title: Rs 30 crore fraud case: Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt, wife arrested in Mumbai
description: Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt and his wife Shwetambari were apprehended in Mumbai early Sunday concerning a ₹30 crore fraud case filed in Udaipur. An IVF specialist accused them of inducing him to invest in a biopic, promising substantial returns that never materialized. The couple, along with others, faces charges, and police are investigating financial dealings.

title: 'Vande Mataram' discussion in Parliament today, sparks set to fly
description: PM Modi to initiate debate in Lok Sabha, Amit Shah to be the main BJP speaker in Rajya Sabha

title: Tom Hicks, former owner of Stars, Rangers and Liverpool FC, dies at 79
description: Texas businessman Tom Hicks, renowned for his ownership of the Dallas Stars, Texas Rangers, and investment in Liverpool FC, has passed away at 79. His tenure saw the Stars win the Stanley Cup and the Rangers reach the World Series. Hicks's significant impact on sports and private equity leaves a lasting legacy.

title: Youth share tales of harassment at PDP meet on why Kashmiri professionals are turning to violence
description: Organised by the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), the conference was attended by the relatives of active militants, youth facing militancy charges and students who get ‘hounded’ outside J&K after militant attacks in Kashmir

title: Death toll rises to 5 after explosion outside a police station in Mexico’s Michoacán state
description: The number of victims killed in an explosion outside a police station in the western Mexican state of Michoacán over the weekend has risen to five

title: High-pitched campaign for local body polls ends in Ernakulam
description: Development takes centre stage with the Chief Minister’s recent campaign speech in the city, in which he listed LDF government’s achievements; Congress says his claims are far from reality

title: Thermal maps for daily choices: SatLeo tests street-level heat intelligence in Karnataka
description: SatLeo Labs is developing thermal mapping technology using satellite and drone data to provide hyper-local temperature insights. This innovation aims to optimize urban planning, manage outdoor labor conditions, and detect environmental hazards like methane leaks, ultimately making cities cooler and safer for residents and workers.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury update: Cowboys speak out as return timeline unclear
description: Dallas Cowboys coach Brian Schottenheimer provided an update on CeeDee Lamb's concussion, stating he had a good day but must complete all necessary checks. Lamb sustained the injury during the game against the Detroit Lions. Neuroscientist Dr. Chris Nowinski raised concerns about the severity of the brain injury, sparking fan panic.

More than half of Tamil estampages covered under ASI’s ongoing digitisation drive

Chinese national quizzed for visiting Kashmir without permission
description: A 29-year-old Chinese tourist faced questioning in Budgam, Kashmir, for unauthorized travel to J&K and Ladakh, violating his visa. He claimed to have visited Zanskar and expressed interest in books about Kashmir. The man, who arrived in Delhi on November 19, flew to Leh without registering, potentially facing deportation.

title: Letters to The Editor — December 8, 2025
​Balancing, not swinging: on India-Russia ties, Indian diplomacy
description: India needs to assert strategic autonomy by engaging both Russia and West

title: BJP to raise issues related to scholarships, paddy procurement in Jharkhand Assembly's winter session
description: The needy students are not getting their scholarships. The government is yet to begin the procurement of paddy from farmers. The farmers are being forced to sell their paddy to middlemen at a low price, says Leader of Opposition Babulal Marandi.

description: The state’s focus should shift away from “what’s there to hide?” to a combination of “what’s there to see?” and a mission to improve digital literacy

description: It must expand its bus fleet to ensure services are frequent and reliable

title: New rules to make drunk-driving checks more reliable from April
description: Starting April, breath analysers will adhere to new consumer affairs department norms, mandating enhanced accuracy and a built-in printer. These updated devices will display only the final BAC result, ensuring verifiable records and reducing misinterpretation. The measures aim to boost public trust in enforcement and improve the efficiency of drunk driving checks.

His calm approach, emotional intelligence, and unwavering self-control, exemplified by winning the Ticket to Finale task and receiving praise from Salman Khan, made him a respected contestant. Khanna's calculated gameplay and genuine bonds highlighted his integrity and inner strength, proving calmness can be revolutionary.

Tariffs to put 'America first': Is Trump spelling doom for US? Economics explained
description: President Donald Trump's "America First" tariff policy has led to record revenue collections, but economic data reveals Americans bear the brunt of the costs. Tariffs are increasingly passed on to consumers and businesses, raising prices and contradicting claims of foreign payment, if rules of economics are studies. This strategy creates a dilemma between political popularity and growing economic burdens on households.

Netflix sends 'late night letter' to its 300 million subscribers
description: Netflix is acquiring Warner Bros. in an $82.7 billion deal, bringing HBO Max and HBO under its umbrella.  While assuring subscribers "nothing is changing today," the streaming giant anticipates a 12-18 month closing period.  Despite Netflix's assurances of a pro-consumer move, politicians and industry groups have raised significant concerns about potential price hikes and job losses.

title: ‘Operation Hotspot Domination’: Weapon suppliers, drug smugglers among 29 arrested by Panchkula police in four days
Bill Gates' daughter gets $30M for AI app: Gates says won't invest; works helpdesk
description: Phoebe Gates' artificial intelligence shopping startup, Phia, has raised $30 million in new funding. This investment values the company at $180 million. Bill Gates, Phoebe's father, has supported the venture with his time and experience. Phia aims to make online shopping smarter and more sustainable. The app offers price comparisons, discounts, and secondhand options.

title: Grim theory on missing coach Travis Turner as veteran cop warns chilling clues
description: A missing Virginia football coach, Travis Turner, may never be found. He vanished from his home on November 20. Authorities charged him with child pornography offenses. A law enforcement expert states dense woods and wildlife make recovery difficult. Search teams are using advanced tools, but success remains uncertain. A reward is offered for information leading to his arrest.

title: Anna Kournikova & Enrique Iglesias net worth 2025: Career, earnings, biz
description: Tennis star Anna Kournikova and music icon Enrique Iglesias boast a combined net worth of $160 million in 2025. While Kournikova's fame transcended her $4 million prize money through lucrative endorsements, Iglesias' wealth stems from over 130 million record sales and global tours. Both have strategically invested in Miami real estate, contributing to their substantial shared fortune.

title: LeBron James sends heartfelt 'family' message to fans after viral Toronto clip
description: LeBron James felt immense love from Toronto fans during the Lakers' recent game against the Raptors. The NBA legend, touched by the cheers and signs, called the fans "family" and expressed his deep appreciation for their unwavering support. He highlighted the special place Toronto holds in his heart, cherishing the warm welcome he always receives.

title: ‘Metaverse’ budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
description: Meta is reportedly planning to significantly cut its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its virtual reality ambitions. This move follows substantial losses and a lack of consumer interest in its VR products. The company is now prioritizing its artificial intelligence initiatives.
